chargeHist.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant David Paul Lesage was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.198(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: DNA surcharge and Domestic abuse surcharge to be paid from prison monies.

Not allowed to vote or serve on a jury until civil right are restored.  Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No contact with victim without prior agent approval.
Assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.  Maintain/obtain full time employment.  Submit DNA sample by 8/3/2022.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other Sentence defendant is currently serving
